author: Special Correspondent
text:
A group of organisations working for the rights of sexual and gender minorities are requesting all political parties to give opportunities to members from the lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender and queer communities in the upcoming Assembly elections.

The group held a press conference on Tuesday.

“We are requesting the Election Commission to reserve seats for these communities to ensure representation of their needs. When such representation is available, it will give them an opportunity to improve their status as well as participate in serving others in society,” said A. J. Hariharan, founder-secretary, Indian Community Welfare Organisation.

Jaya, general manager, Sahodaran, said a few transwomen had already applied with their parties — Ragasiya with the DMK, Radhika with the DMDK and Sudha with the AIADMK.

One other transwoman, Devi, had been nominated from Naam Thamizhar Katchi, she said.

“Every leading political party should nominate at least one person from the LGBTQ community,” she said “A transgender person in the government will be truly inspiring and will be able to create an enabling environment and encourage more people to come forward,” she added.

Among the 14 organisations that are behind this request are Nirangal, South India AIDS Action Programme and SAATHI.
title: Give opportunities to sexual minorities, parties urged
